It means you can save work by only modelling and unwrapping one and copying that geometry (perhaps with small changes), and it gives you the option to paint features into the texture such as highlighting the tip, or pushing the colour at the base further towards that of the material the horn will be growing from. You could go even further and try and paint out the seams, but depending on how the horn is used it may not be worth that effort.

post.author: ratty redemption
post.body:
black dog wrote:
Oops, should have kept an eye on this thread.

np, although I do intend to update this thread regularly when I`m working on the map and people seem interested to follow its progress.

Quote:
Yes. Before 2.42 this kind of merging was still possible by placing the cursor near a selected vertex, snapping the cursor to the selection, making a new selection and then merging that to the cursor. That was a big pain in the ass. Now there's "merge to first" and "merge to last" in the merge menu, which perform this function nicely. This is particularly useful for optimizing low poly work.

understood and agreed the old method is a pain to work with, so I`m now dl 2.42a because I often merge vertices and the new method sound much better

Quote:
Yes, I do roughly the same thing. The problem with this comes when you wish to make a clean, grid aligned slice through an object with off-grid vertices. Curves are a good example. When slicing those I always end up shuffling the new vertexes around to get them aligned, and that's not an effective way to work. Blender is entirely capable of making a clean grid-aligned cut, there's just no tool to do it at the moment.

understood and agreed they should fix this.

I haven`t yet used the boolean tools or the modifier stack, other then subsurf, armatures and wave modifiers for my music animation project.

one of the tasks I least enjoy when modeling my meshes is when I have two rows of verts I want to merge together along the seam, rather then all into the same vertex. I know if they are edge loops we can use the "3d view\mesh menu\scripts\bridge faces/edge loops" but with open ended rows it`s a pain to merge each pair of verts together.

some times I select each pair at a time and use the "s key" to drag them together, then use "w key\remove doubles" which although that whole process takes about the same time as using "w key\merge\at center" on each pair, I find the scaling method slightly more fun. what method do you use?

Quote:
The easiest way to verify that your vertex colours have exported is to load up the .ase file in a text editor and search for MESH_VERTCOL. Vertex colours are indexed in the .ase format in lines that look like this:

*MESH_VERTCOL 0 1.0000 1.0000 1.0000

If you are missing those, the exporter hasn't included vertex colours.

cool and thanks

Quote:
Looks like you've got the idea. The crack running underneath looks like it'll hide seams very well. I would be a touch wary of adding features like that for the sole reason of hiding seams, as you want your model to be shaped naturally and believably as well as appearing seamless - but from that shot, it looks ok.

thanks and I`m still experimenting, but for some of the rocks I think cracks in them are a natural place to hide the seams, although I agree I can`t use that method on every model.

Quote:
As kit said, I'd unwrap those with a single seam running up the back. I agree that having all three horns share the same uvspace is a good idea. It means you can save work by only modeling and unwrapping one and copying that geometry (perhaps with small changes), and it gives you the option to paint features into the texture such as highlighting the tip, or pushing the colour at the base further towards that of the material the horn will be growing from. You could go even further and try and paint out the seams, but depending on how the horn is used it may not be worth that effort.

thanks and I`ll try a single seam up the back of the horns, I also thought about painting details onto the texture to fit within the exact shape of the horns rather then just use a wall like texture like they apparently did with the original d3 horns/saber teeth. and I`ve been vertex blending them into a rock or dirt texture which seems to work quite well, although the scale is a bit different since the rock models use a large scale on them then the rock base of the horns.

thanks for the suggestion, but I don`t think I`ll try painting out the seems, although I`ve done that before on some of the d3 character models for my personal mod. it is very time consuming especially when editing the local, height and specular textures as well as the diffuse (color) texture, not that these horns use all those material stages but it`s low priority, as plan to spend as much time on building as many models as possible, as well as all the sp game play events I have in mind

post.author: Black Dog
post.body:
Quote:
one of the tasks I least enjoy when modeling my meshes is when I have two rows of verts I want to merge together along the seam, rather then all into the same vertex. I know if they are edge loops we can use the "3d view\mesh menu\scripts\bridge faces/edge loops" but with open ended rows it`s a pain to merge each pair of verts together.


Yes, that can be one of those tricky situations. If things are nicely aligned axially, sometimes you can get away with using the scaling trick constrained to an axis and do the whole lot at once. Also if you are doing radial work, sometimes you can avoid having to handle each vertex on a curve with smart use of scaling around the cursor, which can get you close enough that remove doubles will finish the job. Those are only special cases though, and anywhere they don't work I typically use either merge to target vertex or merge to center on individual pairs of verts.

Quote:
thanks for the suggestion, but I don`t think I`ll try painting out the seems


That comment was more to point out what advantages that kind of unwrapping can have than an actual suggestion. There's no point in doing unnecessary work, after all.

post.author: ratty redemption
post.body:
black dog wrote:
Yes, that can be one of those tricky situations. If things are nicely aligned axially, sometimes you can get away with using the scaling trick constrained to an axis and do the whole lot at once.


thanks and I`ve used the scaling to an axis a few times in the past, but recently found it doesn`t work with most of the jagged edge loops my rocks have, which is a shame as it`s so fast and easy if the rows are axial to start with.

Quote:
Also if you are doing radial work, sometimes you can avoid having to handle each vertex on a curve with smart use of scaling around the cursor, which can get you close enough that remove doubles will finish the job.


interesting and thanks, I will keep it in mind

Quote:
Those are only special cases though, and anywhere they don't work I typically use either merge to target vertex or merge to center on individual pairs of verts.


understood and I wonder if they will ever give us a merge row type tool which works on these kind of organic shaped meshes?

Quote:
That comment was more to point out what advantages that kind of unwrapping can have than an actual suggestion. There's no point in doing unnecessary work, after all.


understood and agreed, and it was a cool idea

in the past I`ve concentrated more on adding as much detail as I can to everything I worked on, where by now because I know I have commitments to other projects so have less time available, I`m trying to improve my work flow by only adding in detail where the player is most likely to notice it, and then still keep it at a sensible level.

in fact when I first started building that rock bridge I didn`t intend the player to go up there, but I got carried away with adding detail to the top of the bridge, so have now concept designed a route which will take the player up there, hehe.

post.author: ratty redemption
post.body:
just a quick update to show the newly remapped horn model, currently using one of the original d3 textures.



I did vertically stretch the uv`s after running lscm (or as it`s now called "unwrap" in blender 2.42a) so they could fit better the texture.

post.author: ratty redemption
post.body:
sorry for lack of updates. the last few days I`ve been ill with a cold and previous to that I traveled up to derby for the bloodstock music festival with my girlfriend. although while there and on the trains and coaches I was able to do some concept designing, and review in my mind the construction methods I`ve been using on this map`s models to date.

my conclusion is the beveled cracks to hide the uv seams on the undersides of the rock bridge and some of the floating rocks was a waste of polys, especially as the player couldn`t really see them in game unless they noclipped into the air, to get close enough to the undersides of those rocks.

so when I got home from our long weekend, I merged the polys along either side of the uv seams, as well as redoing the seams and un wrapping for the first rocks I built.

what I have done though is added in some beveled edges to the cracks the player is likely to see, as they are a better use of the polys I think.

image shack seems slow today so I`ve only managed to ul one image so far, but will ul and post links to the finished rock bridge asap.

for now here`s a blender image of the latest version of the first rock, which the player spawns onto.



I also ran the blender script "uv/image editor\uv menu\texture baker" to output a version of the original pentastic1.tga texture, so in psp7 I could fade to black the inner edges where the decal sits on top of the rock`s cracks.

I`m especially pleased with how I got the decal`s mesh to follow the contours of those beveled cracks.

post.author: ratty redemption
post.body: here`s the rest of the screen images I was trying to ul earlier. note there are some ugly shadows that I couldn`t get rid of just by tweaking the models or materials, but I`m reasonably happy with the lighting and feel I can move onto the other models I intend to build for this area.

post.author: ratty redemption
post.body: the floating rock in the middle of the rock bridge is currently a func_bobbing but it was a real pain to get the bobbing height and speed right. what other options are their available in d3 and which do you guys recommend?

post.author: kit89
post.body:
Excellent Ratty, looks fantastic.

How many poly's/faces is the entire scene?

post.author: ratty redemption
post.body:
thanks kit89, and according to blender, before goofos`s exporter has triangulated the quad faces, there are:

verts 1872
faces 1881

post.body:
Real hellish scene here!
I really like the new player skin too (for what i can see), especially his hairs...

post.author: ratty redemption
post.body:
6th venom, thanks and although it was intended just a personal mod, I could release it perhaps in separate .pk4`s either when this hell map is ready or before.

I`ve also redone a lot of the particle effects, like imp, hellknight and vulgar fireballs, bullet sparks, plasmagun trails, some explosions etc. which I`ll try to show in screen images when this map is more populated with monsters.

I do accept not everyone would say want the player skin and particle effects, so if they are in separate .pk4`s then players can choose which parts of my mod they want to use.

here`s an older d3 test map I was working on last year, which might show more clearly my version of the d3 player skin, I`ve used the same dark grey and chrome theme for the d3xp version as well. I`m not sure what you mean by his hairs as I didn`t alter the head or arms part of the original textures.

post.body:
http://img241.imageshack.us/img241/8085 ... sz5.th.jpg
On this one it seems to be a different head that the original doom marine's one... maybe it's due to the darkness.

post.author: ratty redemption
post.body:
he`s the marine from d3xp which is slightly different from the original d3 marine, but other then that, yes it could be the lighting as I didn`t alter either of their heads.

although if I had time and knew how to I`d like to give the d3xp one a short black mohawk and some tatoos

post.author: kat
post.body:
ratty redemption wrote:
the floating rock in the middle of the rock bridge is currently a func_bobbing but it was a real pain to get the bobbing height and speed right. what other options are their available in d3 and which do you guys recommend?
Animate it and export as an MD5 with a collision hull.

The maps a lot bigger than it initially look from the earlier screenshots but it looks like you've got some decent UVWmaps done on what are fundamentally (emphasis on 'mentally') difficult objects to unwrap.

post.author: ratty redemption
post.body:
thanks kat

do you have any links to tuts on setting up and exporting .md5`s?

also would the collision hull be a simpler mesh version of the floating rock?

ot: I would of replied to your post sooner, but some of last posts in here I didn`t receive an email notification this thread has been updated, and I checked the option is ticked in both my profile and when I post.

post.author: ratty redemption
post.body:
I`ve being doing some tests with trying to get a hellknight to follow a path around a section of the rock bridge, but he keeps falling off. here`s an image of gtk radiant 1.5 showing the model section, the simplified "common\monster_clip" textured brushes, and some path corners.



I don`t really want to build monster clip brushes on the sides of the bridge, like some invisible hand rails, if I can avoid it, so do you guys have any other suggestions?

post.author: kat
post.body: Use the AI solid textures, I think they're in a different folder than /common. Basically they more or less what DONOTENTER was in Q3, they act as a 'solid' area to bots but they can pass though them physically (if shot for example).

post.author: ratty redemption
post.body: thanks a lot kat, that sounds ideal. I`ll try this soon and report back

post.author: ratty redemption
post.body:
I haven`t yet had time to try out the AI solid which kat suggested, and I`m sorry again for the lack of updates.

last week and today I got some more modeling done to the hell map, but I also spent another long weekend with my girlfriend, this time in her home town of milton keynes.

we`re now planning for me to move up there over the next couple of weeks, so I`m not sure how much of the hell map I`ll get done until I`m fully set up in her flat. although she does have broadband which will be a welcome upgrade from my 56k I`ve been using for years.

the hell map is at the top of my project list and it will definitely get released oneday, in the mean time I`ll do as much as I can to it when ever possible and keep you people here updated.

I do have a new technical issue I`d like help with.

in these screen images, your see I have built a tunnel entrance into the rock walls at the bottom of the main cave, with the lava flowing into the tunnel. but as the tunnel slopes downwards, I`m having difficulty with the lava fog lights as having two next to each other doesn`t look good in game, I assume because we can see the sides of the fog volume.

is there a way to simulate the fog following the contours of the lava or should I leave out the fog lights?

post.author: kit89
post.body:
I would suggest leaving out the fog and just add in some rising smoke.

If your able to get really close to the lava, I would suggest creating a script that at a certain distance removes the fog &/or smoke and creates a light heat wave affect infront of the player.

Not sure if this can be done in Doom3 tho, as I have only just been able to buy a legal copy of Doom.

post.author: ratty redemption
post.body: good point, kit89 and I will be using heat haze and smoke effects so they will make the lava look more realistic, but afaik their not dynamically culled in the d3 engine.

post.author: ratty redemption
post.body:
for the time being I`ve finished the small floating rocks in the hell map`s first area, and have now started on the large chains as shown in the image below.

next I intend to model some metal cages which will be either resting on floating rocks or suspended from the chains between rocks. the cages will have ammo, weapons and or monsters in them, which in turn will spawn flying monsters like lost souls and caco demons outside the cages. should be fun when I get round to them

I`ve also redone a lot of the particle effects, like imp, hellknight and vulgar fireballs, bullet sparks, plasmagun trails, some explosions etc. which I`ll try to show in screen images when this map is more populated with monsters.

I do accept not everyone would say want the player skin and particle effects, so if they are in separate .pk4`s then players can choose which parts of my mod they want to use.

here`s an older d3 test map I was working on last year, which might show more clearly my version of the d3 player skin, I`ve used the same dark grey and chrome theme for the d3xp version as well. I`m not sure what you mean by his hairs as I didn`t alter the head or arms part of the original textures.

post.author: 6th Venom
post.body:
http://img241.imageshack.us/img241/8085 ... sz5.th.jpg
On this one it seems to be a different head that the original doom marine's one... maybe it's due to the darkness.

post.author: ratty redemption
post.body:
he`s the marine from d3xp which is slightly different from the original d3 marine, but other then that, yes it could be the lighting as I didn`t alter either of their heads.

although if I had time and knew how to I`d like to give the d3xp one a short black mohawk and some tatoos

post.author: kat
post.body:
ratty redemption wrote:
the floating rock in the middle of the rock bridge is currently a func_bobbing but it was a real pain to get the bobbing height and speed right. what other options are their available in d3 and which do you guys recommend?
Animate it and export as an MD5 with a collision hull.

The maps a lot bigger than it initially look from the earlier screenshots but it looks like you've got some decent UVWmaps done on what are fundamentally (emphasis on 'mentally') difficult objects to unwrap.

post.author: ratty redemption
post.body:
thanks kat

do you have any links to tuts on setting up and exporting .md5`s?

also would the collision hull be a simpler mesh version of the floating rock?

ot: I would of replied to your post sooner, but some of last posts in here I didn`t receive an email notification this thread has been updated, and I checked the option is ticked in both my profile and when I post.

post.author: ratty redemption
post.body:
I`ve being doing some tests with trying to get a hellknight to follow a path around a section of the rock bridge, but he keeps falling off. here`s an image of gtk radiant 1.5 showing the model section, the simplified "common\monster_clip" textured brushes, and some path corners.



I don`t really want to build monster clip brushes on the sides of the bridge, like some invisible hand rails, if I can avoid it, so do you guys have any other suggestions?

post.author: kat
post.body: Use the AI solid textures, I think they're in a different folder than /common. Basically they more or less what DONOTENTER was in Q3, they act as a 'solid' area to bots but they can pass though them physically (if shot for example).

post.author: ratty redemption
post.body: thanks a lot kat, that sounds ideal. I`ll try this soon and report back

post.author: ratty redemption
post.body:
I haven`t yet had time to try out the AI solid which kat suggested, and I`m sorry again for the lack of updates.

last week and today I got some more modeling done to the hell map, but I also spent another long weekend with my girlfriend, this time in her home town of milton keynes.

we`re now planning for me to move up there over the next couple of weeks, so I`m not sure how much of the hell map I`ll get done until I`m fully set up in her flat. although she does have broadband which will be a welcome upgrade from my 56k I`ve been using for years.

the hell map is at the top of my project list and it will definitely get released oneday, in the mean time I`ll do as much as I can to it when ever possible and keep you people here updated.

I do have a new technical issue I`d like help with.

in these screen images, your see I have built a tunnel entrance into the rock walls at the bottom of the main cave, with the lava flowing into the tunnel. but as the tunnel slopes downwards, I`m having difficulty with the lava fog lights as having two next to each other doesn`t look good in game, I assume because we can see the sides of the fog volume.

is there a way to simulate the fog following the contours of the lava or should I leave out the fog lights?

post.author: kit89
post.body:
I would suggest leaving out the fog and just add in some rising smoke.

If your able to get really close to the lava, I would suggest creating a script that at a certain distance removes the fog &/or smoke and creates a light heat wave affect infront of the player.

Not sure if this can be done in Doom3 tho, as I have only just been able to buy a legal copy of Doom.

post.author: ratty redemption
post.body: good point, kit89 and I will be using heat haze and smoke effects so they will make the lava look more realistic, but afaik their not dynamically culled in the d3 engine.

post.author: ratty redemption
post.body:
for the time being I`ve finished the small floating rocks in the hell map`s first area, and have now started on the large chains as shown in the image below.

next I intend to model some metal cages which will be either resting on floating rocks or suspended from the chains between rocks. the cages will have ammo, weapons and or monsters in them, which in turn will spawn flying monsters like lost souls and caco demons outside the cages. should be fun when I get round to them

post.author: ratty redemption
post.body:
after 4 attempts at ul this next image onto imageshack, it finally worked

so here is an in game wire frame image of the floating rocks and chain, with the player standing on top the chain.

although since the 3rd pers

post.author: ratty redemption
post.body: here`s the rest of the screen images I was trying to ul earlier. note there are some ugly shadows that I couldn`t get rid of just by tweaking the models or materials, but I`m reasonably happy with the lighting and feel I can move onto the other models I intend to build for this area.

post.author: ratty redemption
post.body: the floating rock in the middle of the rock bridge is currently a func_bobbing but it was a real pain to get the bobbing height and speed right. what other options are their available in d3 and which do you guys recommend?

post.author: kit89
post.body:
Excellent Ratty, looks fantastic.

How many poly's/faces is the entire scene?

post.author: ratty redemption
post.body:
thanks kit89, and according to blender, before goofos`s exporter has triangulated the quad faces, there are:

verts 1872
faces 1881

post.author: ratty redemption
post.body:
I haven`t yet had time to try out the AI solid which kat suggested, and I`m sorry again for the lack of updates.

last week and today I got some more modeling done to the hell map, but I also spent another long weekend with my girlfriend, this time in her home town of milton keynes.

we`re now planning for me to move up there over the next couple of weeks, so I`m not sure how much of the hell map I`ll get done until I`m fully set up in her flat. although she does have broadband which will be a welcome upgrade from my 56k I`ve been using for years.

the hell map is at the top of my project list and it will definitely get released oneday, in the mean time I`ll do as much as I can to it when ever possible and keep you people here updated.

I do have a new technical issue I`d like help with.

in these screen images, your see I have built a tunnel entrance into the rock walls at the bottom of the main cave, with the lava flowing into the tunnel. but as the tunnel slopes downwards, I`m having difficulty with the lava fog lights as having two next to each other doesn`t look good in game, I assume because we can see the sides of the fog volume.

is there a way to simulate the fog following the contours of the lava or should I leave out the fog lights?

post.author: kit89
post.body:
I would suggest leaving out the fog and just add in some rising smoke.

If your able to get really close to the lava, I would suggest creating a script that at a certain distance removes the fog &/or smoke and creates a light heat wave affect infront of the player.

Not sure if this can be done in Doom3 tho, as I have only just been able to buy a legal copy of Doom.

post.author: ratty redemption
post.body: good point, kit89 and I will be using heat haze and smoke effects so they will make the lava look more realistic, but afaik their not dynamically culled in the d3 engine.

post.author: ratty redemption
post.body:
for the time being I`ve finished the small floating rocks in the hell map`s first area, and have now started on the large chains as shown in the image below.

next I intend to model some metal cages which will be either resting on floating rocks or suspended from the chains between rocks. the cages will have ammo, weapons and or monsters in them, which in turn will spawn flying monsters like lost souls and caco demons outside the cages. should be fun when I get round to them

post.author: ratty redemption
post.body:
after 4 attempts at ul this next image onto imageshack, it finally worked

so here is an in game wire frame image of the floating rocks and chain, with the player standing on top the chain.

although since the 3rd perso

post.author: ratty redemption
post.body: here`s the rest of the screen images I was trying to ul earlier. note there are some ugly shadows that I couldn`t get rid of just by tweaking the models or materials, but I`m reasonably happy with the lighting and feel I can move onto the other models I intend to build for this area.

post.author: ratty redemption
post.body: the floating rock in the middle of the rock bridge is currently a func_bobbing but it was a real pain to get the bobbing height and speed right. what other options are their available in d3 and which do you guys recommend?

post.author: kit89
post.body:
Excellent Ratty, looks fantastic.

How many poly's/faces is the entire scene?

post.author: ratty redemption
post.body:
thanks kit89, and according to blender, before goofos`s exporter has triangulated the quad faces, there are:

verts 1872
faces 1881

post.author: 6th Venom
post.body:
Real hellish scene here!
I really like the new player skin too (for what i can see), especially his hairs...

post.author: ratty redemption
post.body:
6th venom, thanks and although it was intended just a personal mod, I could release it perhaps in separate .pk4`s either when this hell map is ready or before.

I`ve also redone a lot of the particle effects, like imp, hellknight and vulgar fireballs, bullet sparks, plasmagun trails, some explosions etc. which I`ll try to show in screen images when this map is more populated with monsters.

I do accept not everyone would say want the player skin and particle effects, so if they are in separate .pk4`s then players can choose which parts of my mod they want to use.

here`s an older d3 test map I was working on last year, which might show more clearly my version of the d3 player skin, I`ve used the same dark grey and chrome theme for the d3xp version as well. I`m not sure what you mean by his hairs as I didn`t alter the head or arms part of the original textures.

post.author: 6th Venom
post.body:
http://img241.imageshack.us/img241/8085 ... sz5.th.jpg
On this one it seems to be a different head that the original doom marine's one... maybe it's due to the darkness.

post.author: ratty redemption
post.body:
he`s the marine from d3xp which is slightly different from the original d3 marine, but other then that, yes it could be the lighting as I didn`t alter either of their heads.

although if I had time and knew how to I`d like to give the d3xp one a short black mohawk and some tatoos

post.author: kat
post.body:
ratty redemption wrote:
the floating rock in the middle of the rock bridge is currently a func_bobbing but it was a real pain to get the bobbing height and speed right. what other options are their available in d3 and which do you guys recommend?
Animate it and export as an MD5 with a collision hull.

The maps a lot bigger than it initially look from the earlier screenshots but it looks like you've got some decent UVWmaps done on what are fundamentally (emphasis on 'mentally') difficult objects to unwrap.

post.author: ratty redemption
post.body:
thanks kat

do you have any links to tuts on setting up and exporting .md5`s?

also would the collision hull be a simpler mesh version of the floating rock?

ot: I would of replied to your post sooner, but some of last posts in here I didn`t receive an email notification this thread has been updated, and I checked the option is ticked in both my profile and when I post.

post.author: ratty redemption
post.body:
I`ve being doing some tests with trying to get a hellknight to follow a path around a section of the rock bridge, but he keeps falling off. here`s an image of gtk radiant 1.5 showing the model section, the simplified "common\monster_clip" textured brushes, and some path corners.



I don`t really want to build monster clip brushes on the sides of the bridge, like some invisible hand rails, if I can avoid it, so do you guys have any other suggestions?

post.author: kat
post.body: Use the AI solid textures, I think they're in a different folder than /common. Basically they more or less what DONOTENTER was in Q3, they act as a 'solid' area to bots but they can pass though them physically (if shot for example).

post.author: ratty redemption
post.body: thanks a lot kat, that sounds ideal. I`ll try this soon and report back

post.author: ratty redemption
post.body: thanks a lot kat, that sounds ideal. I`ll try this soon and report back

post.author: ratty redemption
post.body:
I haven`t yet had time to try out the AI solid which kat suggested, and I`m sorry again for the lack of updates.

last week and today I got some more modeling done to the hell map, but I also spent another long weekend with my girlfriend, this time in her home town of milton keynes.

we`re now planning for me to move up there over the next couple of weeks, so I`m not sure how much of the hell map I`ll get done until I`m fully set up in her flat. although she does have broadband which will be a welcome upgrade from my 56k I`ve been using for years.

the hell map is at the top of my project list and it will definitely get released oneday, in the mean time I`ll do as much as I can to it when ever possible and keep you people here updated.

I do have a new technical issue I`d like help with.

in these screen images, your see I have built a tunnel entrance into the rock walls at the bottom of the main cave, with the lava flowing into the tunnel. but as the tunnel slopes downwards, I`m having difficulty with the lava fog lights as having two next to each other doesn`t look good in game, I assume because we can see the sides of the fog volume.

is there a way to simulate the fog following the contours of the lava or should I leave out the fog lights?

post.author: kit89
post.body:
I would suggest leaving out the fog and just add in some rising smoke.

If your able to get really close to the lava, I would suggest creating a script that at a certain distance removes the fog &/or smoke and creates a light heat wave affect infront of the player.

Not sure if this can be done in Doom3 tho, as I have only just been able to buy a legal copy of Doom.

post.author: ratty redemption
post.body: good point, kit89 and I will be using heat haze and smoke effects so they will make the lava look more realistic, but afaik their not dynamically culled in the d3 engine.

post.author: ratty redemption
post.body:
understood and it took me a while to learn how to export even static meshes in blender, although the d3w blender forum helped a lot, especially if using goofos`s .ase exporter script for blender.

also various users have found different d3 paths work or don`t work for them, for me personally, I have all my .ase models use the "w:/doom/base/" prefix for the texture paths which works perfectly on my system, although I think kat uses one of the others.

the weird thing is I don`t have a w: drive or partition so it must be something coded into the engine from when they were developing it, but I remember I had great difficultly getting d3 to use my custom paths before using the prefix.

sorry if you already know the above fix, but someone reading this might not be even aware of this export issue let alone the fixes.

post.author: Bo$bevok
post.body:
no i thank you ratty because i was just trying one path
now iwill try some different ones

post.author: Goofos
post.body: It should also work with other drive letters. I extracted all textures to E:\Doom\base and if the image has the same name and path as the doom3 material it should work without altering the ase file.

post.author: ratty redemption
post.body:
Bo$bevok, cool and good luck

Goofos, I think I understand but could you post an example of a material shader and the material name you`d use in blender, or if you don`t want to in this thread, perhaps a link to an example in your .ase exporter`s development thread?

post.author: kit89
post.body:
Getting textures to work properly on models is a pain. What I did was extract pak004.pk4(I think) and just matched what I did up with the ones I new actually worked.

You need like 3 different files. The model, the texture, and then a .mtr that actually sets it up to work properly.

post.author: ratty redemption
post.body:
this is the second time I`ve built the first of my hell cages, the first version I had used 6 sided cylinders for the bars, which I then decided were a waste of polys, so reduced them to 4 sided. for some reason that took longer to build then the 6 sided version.

and although I spent a lot of time on experimenting where to place the uv seams, I still ended up tweaking the uv map a lot which I haven`t had to do recently with the rock or terrain models.

but while working on this hell cage I discovered the very useful "w key/align x or y" tool in the uv/image editor window. this ment I could quickly clean up the hell cage metal bars uv`s. so before I started bending them out of shape, I had a wip version where the uv`s were very neatly mapped to the polys with hardly any stretching, and after bending the bars I`m still very pleased with the uv map

hopefully the next one of these cages I build I`ll be able to model and uv map it a lot quicker.

post.author: Goofos
post.body:
Sorry, haven't read your previous post. A simple example, you need:

1. a Doom3 Material named

textures/base_wall/superpipes

2. a image for texturing in Blender, stored in the path

E:\Doom\base\textures\base_wall\superpipes.tga

3. in Blender a Material for your mesh with a Texture into which you load that image (once loaded you can select it in the UV editor)

If you export the model, you dont need to change the *BITMAP lines because it have a usable path doom3 can interpret as material. The only important thing is you have to store the image in the right path:

\doom\base\ + material name as path

The drive letter and file extension doesn't matter.

post.body:
understood and thanks a lot goofos

post.author: kit89
post.body: Be careful with a wireless router. They can allow other people to access your network. I don't trust them.

post.author: ratty redemption
post.body: ot: thanks kit89 and we`re still considering options, but as we`ve got our pc`s in different rooms, it`s not easy to physically wire them together. I`ll pass on your concerns though.

post.author: BNA!
post.body:
ratty redemption wrote:
ot: thanks kit89 and we`re still considering options, but as we`ve got our pc`s in different rooms, it`s not easy to physically wire them together. I`ll pass on your concerns though.


Just don't leave them unprotected - enable encryption and you're all set.
Unless you're the CEO of an investment bank it's not worth the hassle for a hacker to bypass a 256bit key.

E:\Doom\base\textures\base_wall\superpipes.tga

3. in Blender a Material for your mesh with a Texture into which you load that image (once loaded you can select it in the UV editor)

If you export the model, you dont need to change the *BITMAP lines because it have a usable path doom3 can interpret as material. The only important thing is you have to store the image in the right path:

\doom\base\ + material name as path

The drive letter and file extension doesn't matter.

post.author: ratty redemption
post.body:
understood and it took me a while to learn how to export even static meshes in blender, although the d3w blender forum helped a lot, especially if using goofos`s .ase exporter script for blender.

also various users have found different d3 paths work or don`t work for them, for me personally, I have all my .ase models use the "w:/doom/base/" prefix for the texture paths which works perfectly on my system, although I think kat uses one of the others.

the weird thing is I don`t have a w: drive or partition so it must be something coded into the engine from when they were developing it, but I remember I had great difficultly getting d3 to use my custom paths before using the prefix.

sorry if you already know the above fix, but someone reading this might not be even aware of this export issue let alone the fixes.

post.author: ratty redemption
post.body:
Bo$bevok, cool and good luck

Goofos, I think I understand but could you post an example of a material shader and the material name you`d use in blender, or if you don`t want to in this thread, perhaps a link to an example in your .ase exporter`s development thread?

post.author: kit89
post.body:
Getting textures to work properly on models is a pain. What I did was extract pak004.pk4(I think) and just matched what I did up with the ones I new actually worked.

You need like 3 different files. The model, the texture, and then a .mtr that actually sets it up to work properly.

post.author: ratty redemption
post.body:
this is the second time I`ve built the first of my hell cages, the first version I had used 6 sided cylinders for the bars, which I then decided were a waste of polys, so reduced them to 4 sided. for some reason that took longer to build then the 6 sided version.

and although I spent a lot of time on experimenting where to place the uv seams, I still ended up tweaking the uv map a lot which I haven`t had to do recently with the rock or terrain models.

but while working on this hell cage I discovered the very useful "w key/align x or y" tool in the uv/image editor window. this ment I could quickly clean up the hell cage metal bars uv`s. so before I started bending them out of shape, I had a wip version where the uv`s were very neatly mapped to the polys with hardly any stretching, and after bending the bars I`m still very pleased with the uv map

hopefully the next one of these cages I build I`ll be able to model and uv map it a lot quicker.

/*

/* General page style. The scroll bar colours only visible in IE5.5+ */
body {
	background-color: #E5E5E5;
	scrollbar-face-color: #DEE3E7;
	scrollbar-highlight-color: #FFFFFF;
	scrollbar-shadow-color: #DEE3E7;
	scrollbar-3dlight-color: #D1D7DC;
	scrollbar-arrow-color:  #006699;
	scrollbar-track-color: #EFEFEF;
	scrollbar-darkshadow-color: #98AAB1;
}

/* General font families for common tags */
font,th,td,p { font-family: Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif }
a:link,a:active,a:visited { color : #006699; }
a:hover		{ text-decoration: underline; color : #DD6900; }
hr	{ height: 0px; border: solid #D1D7DC 0px; border-top-width: 1px;}

/* This is the border line & background colour round the entire page */
.bodyline	{ background-color: #FFFFFF; border: 1px #98AAB1 solid; }

/* This is the outline round the main forum tables */
.forumline	{ background-color: #FFFFFF; border: 2px #006699 solid; }

/* Main table cell colours and backgrounds */
td.row1	{ background-color: #EFEFEF; }
td.row2	{ background-color: #DEE3E7; }
td.row3	{ background-color: #D1D7DC; }

/*
  This is for the table cell above the Topics, Post & Last posts on the index.php page
  By default this is the fading out gradiated silver background.
  However, you could replace this with a bitmap specific for each forum
*/
td.rowpic {
		background-color: #FFFFFF;
		background-image: url(https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/cellpic2.jpg);
		background-repeat: repeat-y;
}

/* Header cells - the blue and silver gradient backgrounds */
th	{
	color: #FFA34F; font-size: 11px; font-weight : bold;
	background-color: #006699; height: 25px;
	background-image: url(https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/cellpic3.gif);
}

td.cat,td.catHead,td.catSides,td.catLeft,td.catRight,td.catBottom {
			background-image: url(https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/cellpic1.gif);
			background-color:#D1D7DC; border: #FFFFFF; border-style: solid; height: 28px;
}

/*
  Setting additional nice inner borders for the main table cells.
  The names indicate which sides the border will be on.
  Don't worry if you don't understand this, just ignore it :-)
*/
td.cat,td.catHead,td.catBottom {
	height: 29px;
	border-width: 0px 0px 0px 0px;
}
th.thHead,th.thSides,th.thTop,th.thLeft,th.thRight,th.thBottom,th.thCornerL,th.thCornerR {
	font-weight: bold; border: #FFFFFF; border-style: solid; height: 28px;
}
td.row3Right,td.spaceRow {
	background-color: #D1D7DC; border: #FFFFFF; border-style: solid;
}

th.thHead,td.catHead { font-size: 12px; border-width: 1px 1px 0px 1px; }
th.thSides,td.catSides,td.spaceRow	 { border-width: 0px 1px 0px 1px; }

th.thBottom,td.catBottom  { border-width: 0px 1px 1px 1px; }
th.thTop	 { border-width: 1px 0px 0px 0px; }
th.thCornerL { border-width: 1px 0px 0px 1px; }
th.thCornerR { border-width: 1px 1px 0px 0px; }

/* The largest text used in the index page title and toptic title etc. */
.maintitle	{
	font-weight: bold; font-size: 22px; font-family: "Trebuchet MS",Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;
	text-decoration: none; line-height : 120%; color : #000000;
}

/* General text */
.gen { font-size : 12px; }
.genmed { font-size : 11px; }
.gensmall { font-size : 10px; }
.gen,.genmed,.gensmall { color : #000000; }
a.gen,a.genmed,a.gensmall { color: #006699; text-decoration: none; }

/* The register, login, search etc links at the top of the page */
.mainmenu		{ font-size : 11px; color : #000000 }

a.mainmenu:hover{ text-decoration: underline; color : #DD6900; }

/* Forum category titles */
.cattitle		{ font-weight: bold; font-size: 12px ; letter-spacing: 1px; color : #006699}
a.cattitle		{ text-decoration: none; color : #006699; }
a.cattitle:hover{ text-decoration: underline; }

/* Forum title: Text and link to the forums used in: index.php */
.forumlink		{ font-weight: bold; font-size: 12px; color : #006699; }
a.forumlink 	{ text-decoration: none; color : #006699; }
a.forumlink:hover{ text-decoration: underline; color : #DD6900; }

/* Used for the navigation text, (Page 1,2,3 etc) and the navigation bar when in a forum */
.nav			{ font-weight: bold; font-size: 11px; color : #000000;}
a.nav			{ text-decoration: none; color : #006699; }
a.nav:hover		{ text-decoration: underline; }

/* titles for the topics: could specify viewed link colour too */
.topictitle,h1,h2	{ font-weight: bold; font-size: 11px; color : #000000; }
a.topictitle:link   { text-decoration: none; color : #006699; }
a.topictitle:visited { text-decoration: none; color : #5493B4; }
a.topictitle:hover	{ text-decoration: underline; color : #DD6900; }

/* Name of poster in viewmsg.php and viewtopic.php and other places */
.name			{ font-size : 11px; color : #000000;}

/* Location, number of posts, post date etc */
.postdetails		{ font-size : 10px; color : #000000; }

/* The content of the posts (body of text) */
.postbody { font-size : 12px; line-height: 18px}
a.postlink:link	{ text-decoration: none; color : #006699 }
a.postlink:visited { text-decoration: none; color : #5493B4; }
a.postlink:hover { text-decoration: underline; color : #DD6900}

/* Quote & Code blocks */
.code {
	font-family: Courier, 'Courier New', sans-serif; font-size: 11px; color: #006600;
	background-color: #FAFAFA; border: #D1D7DC; border-style: solid;
	border-left-width: 1px; border-top-width: 1px; border-right-width: 1px; border-bottom-width: 1px
}

.quote {
	font-family: Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 11px; color: #444444; line-height: 125%;
	background-color: #FAFAFA; border: #D1D7DC; border-style: solid;
	border-left-width: 1px; border-top-width: 1px; border-right-width: 1px; border-bottom-width: 1px
}

/* Copyright and bottom info */
.copyright		{ font-size: 10px; font-family: Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; color: #444444; letter-spacing: -1px;}
a.copyright		{ color: #444444; text-decoration: none;}
a.copyright:hover { color: #000000; text-decoration: underline;}

/* Form elements */
input,textarea, select {
	color : #000000;
	font: normal 11px Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;
	border-color : #000000;
}

/* The text input fields background colour */
input.post, textarea.post, select {
	background-color : #FFFFFF;
}

input { text-indent : 2px; }

/* The buttons used for bbCode styling in message post */
input.button {
	background-color : #EFEFEF;
	color : #000000;
	font-size: 11px; font-family: Verdana, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;
}

/* The main submit button option */
input.mainoption {
	background-color : #FAFAFA;
	font-weight : bold;
}

/* None-bold submit button */
input.liteoption {
	background-color : #FAFAFA;
	font-weight : normal;
}

/* This is the line in the posting page which shows the rollover
  help line. This is actually a text box, but if set to be the same
  colour as the background no one will know ;)
*/
.helpline { background-color: #DEE3E7; border-style: none; }

/* Import the fancy styles for IE only (NS4.x doesn't use the @import function) */
@import url("https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/formIE.css");
-->

var curMonth = -1;

var imgWidth = 475;
var yearImgWidth = 25;
var monthImgWidth = 2;

var displayDay = "9";
var displayMonth = "May";
var displayYear = "2007";
var prettyMonths = ["Jan","Feb","Mar","Apr","May","Jun","Jul","Aug","Sep","Oct","Nov","Dec"];

function showTrackers(val) {
	if(val == trackerVal) {
		return;
	}
	if(val == "inline") {
		document.getElementById("displayYearEl").style.color = "#ec008c";
		document.getElementById("displayMonthEl").style.color = "#ec008c";
		document.getElementById("displayDayEl").style.color = "#ec008c";		
	} else {
		document.getElementById("displayYearEl").innerHTML = displayYear;
		document.getElementById("displayYearEl").style.color = "#ff0";
		document.getElementById("displayMonthEl").innerHTML = displayMonth;
		document.getElementById("displayMonthEl").style.color = "#ff0";
		document.getElementById("displayDayEl").innerHTML = displayDay;
		document.getElementById("displayDayEl").style.color = "#ff0";
	}
   document.getElementById("wbMouseTrackYearImg").style.display = val;
   document.getElementById("wbMouseTrackMonthImg").style.display = val;
   trackerVal = val;
}
function getElementX2(obj) {
	var thing = jQuery(obj);
	if((thing == undefined) 
			|| (typeof thing == "undefined") 
			|| (typeof thing.offset == "undefined")) {
		return getElementX(obj);
	}
	return Math.round(thing.offset().left);
}
function trackMouseMove(event,element) {

   var eventX = getEventX(event);
   var elementX = getElementX2(element);
   var xOff = eventX - elementX;
	if(xOff < 0) {
		xOff = 0;
	} else if(xOff > imgWidth) {
		xOff = imgWidth;
	}
   var monthOff = xOff % yearImgWidth;

   var year = Math.floor(xOff / yearImgWidth);
	var yearStart = year * yearImgWidth;
   var monthOfYear = Math.floor(monthOff / monthImgWidth);
   if(monthOfYear > 11) {
       monthOfYear = 11;
   }
   // 1 extra border pixel at the left edge of the year:
   var month = (year * 12) + monthOfYear;
   var day = 1;
	if(monthOff % 2 == 1) {
		day = 15;
	}
	var dateString = 
		zeroPad(year + firstYear) + 
		zeroPad(monthOfYear+1,2) +
		zeroPad(day,2) + "000000";

	var monthString = prettyMonths[monthOfYear];
	document.getElementById("displayYearEl").innerHTML = year + 1996;
	document.getElementById("displayMonthEl").innerHTML = monthString;
	// looks too jarring when it changes..
	//document.getElementById("displayDayEl").innerHTML = zeroPad(day,2);

	var url = wbPrefix + dateString + '/' +  wbCurrentUrl;
	document.getElementById('wm-graph-anchor').href = url;

   //document.getElementById("wmtbURL").value="evX("+eventX+") elX("+elementX+") xO("+xOff+") y("+year+") m("+month+") monthOff("+monthOff+") DS("+dateString+") Moy("+monthOfYear+") ms("+monthString+")";
   if(curYear != year) {
       var yrOff = year * yearImgWidth;
       document.getElementById("wbMouseTrackYearImg").style.left = yrOff + "px";
       curYear = year;
   }
   if(curMonth != month) {
       var mtOff = year + (month * monthImgWidth) + 1;
       document.getElementById("wbMouseTrackMonthImg").style.left = mtOff + "px";
       curMonth = month;
   }
}
//]]]] ><![CDATA[>

			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><hr/></td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><span class="postbody">thanks a lot guys and so far I seem to be keeping the poly count well within the recommended limits <img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/images/smiles/icon_smile.gif" alt="Smile" border="0"/><br/><br/>
Bo$bevok, which modeling app are you using? like me kit89 uses blender and we`re really happy with how blender is being developed, especially as its free <img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/images/smiles/icon_smile.gif" alt="Smile" border="0"/><br/>_________________<br/><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/viewtopic.php?t=17180&postdays=0&postorder=asc&start=0" target="_blank" class="postlink">(wip) ratty d3 hell map</a>
<br/><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.katsbits.com/" target="_blank" class="postlink">katsbits.com</a></span><span class="gensmall"/></td>

				<td valign="top" nowrap="nowrap"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/posting.php?mode=quote&p=160466&sid=38862bb3a0426f0ed156be45955a72ca"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/lang_english/icon_quote.gif" alt="Reply with quote" title="Reply with quote" border="0"/></a>   </td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><hr/></td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><span class="postbody">yes im using blender too - i like how its free <img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/images/smiles/icon_smile.gif" alt="Smile" border="0"/>... i am getting the hang of moddeling there are just one or two things i need to know but not just yet lol.
<br/><br/>
//edit
<br/><br/>
My problem is exporting but ill learn<br/>_________________<br/>"Let me make myself clear: You might be the master of your universe, but D3W.org is mine. " - BNA!</span><span class="gensmall"/></td>

		<td class="row1" width="100%" height="28" valign="top"><table width="100%" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0"><tr><td width="100%"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/viewtopic.php?p=160486&sid=38862bb3a0426f0ed156be45955a72ca#160486"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/icon_minipost.gif" width="12" height="9" alt="Post" title="Post" border="0"/></a><span class="postdetails">Posted: Mon Oct 23, 2006 11:02 pm<span class="gen"></span> Post subject: </span></td>
				<td valign="top" nowrap="nowrap"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/posting.php?mode=quote&p=160486&sid=38862bb3a0426f0ed156be45955a72ca"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/lang_english/icon_quote.gif" alt="Reply with quote" title="Reply with quote" border="0"/></a>   </td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><hr/></td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><span class="postbody">understood and it took me a while to learn how to export even static meshes in blender, although the <a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/viewforum.php?f=50" target="_blank" class="postlink">d3w blender forum</a> helped a lot, especially if using goofos`s .ase exporter script for blender.
<br/><br/>
also various users have found different d3 paths work or don`t work for them, for me personally, I have all my .ase models use the "w:/doom/base/" prefix for the texture paths which works perfectly on my system, although I think kat uses one of the others.
<br/><br/>
the weird thing is I don`t have a w: drive or partition so it must be something coded into the engine from when they were developing it, but I remember I had great difficultly getting d3 to use my custom paths before using the prefix.
<br/><br/>
sorry if you already know the above fix, but someone reading this might not be even aware of this export issue let alone the fixes.<br/>_________________<br/><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/viewtopic.php?t=17180&postdays=0&postorder=asc&start=0" target="_blank" class="postlink">(wip) ratty d3 hell map</a>
<br/><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.katsbits.com/" target="_blank" class="postlink">katsbits.com</a></span><span class="gensmall"/></td>
			</tr></table></td>
	</tr><tr><td class="row1" width="150" align="left" valign="middle"><span class="nav"><a href="viewtopic.php?p=160526#top" class="nav">Back to top</a></span></td>

<br/>
now iwill try some different ones  <img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/images/smiles/icon_wink.gif" alt="Wink" border="0"/><br/>_________________<br/>"Let me make myself clear: You might be the master of your universe, but D3W.org is mine. " - BNA!</span><span class="gensmall"/></td>

		<td class="row1" width="100%" height="28" valign="top"><table width="100%" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0"><tr><td width="100%"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/viewtopic.php?p=160522&sid=38862bb3a0426f0ed156be45955a72ca#160522"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/icon_minipost.gif" width="12" height="9" alt="Post" title="Post" border="0"/></a><span class="postdetails">Posted: Tue Oct 24, 2006 10:48 am<span class="gen"></span> Post subject: </span></td>
				<td valign="top" nowrap="nowrap"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/posting.php?mode=quote&p=160522&sid=38862bb3a0426f0ed156be45955a72ca"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/lang_english/icon_quote.gif" alt="Reply with quote" title="Reply with quote" border="0"/></a>   </td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><hr/></td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><span class="postbody">It should also work with other drive letters. I extracted all textures to E:\Doom\base and if the image has the same name and path as the doom3 material it should work without altering the ase file.</span><span class="gensmall"/></td>
			</tr></table></td>
	</tr><tr><td class="row1" width="150" align="left" valign="middle"><span class="nav"><a href="viewtopic.php?p=160526#top" class="nav">Back to top</a></span></td>

	</tr><tr><td width="150" align="left" valign="top" class="row1"><span class="name"><a name="160545"/><b>kit89</b></span><br/><span class="postdetails">picked up a pistol<br/><br/><br/>Joined: 23 Sep 2006<br/>Posts: 54<br/>Location: Scotland</span><br/></td>
		<td class="row1" width="100%" height="28" valign="top"><table width="100%" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0"><tr><td width="100%"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/viewtopic.php?p=160545&sid=38862bb3a0426f0ed156be45955a72ca#160545"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/icon_minipost.gif" width="12" height="9" alt="Post" title="Post" border="0"/></a><span class="postdetails">Posted: Tue Oct 24, 2006 2:07 pm<span class="gen"></span> Post subject: </span></td>
				<td valign="top" nowrap="nowrap"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/posting.php?mode=quote&p=160545&sid=38862bb3a0426f0ed156be45955a72ca"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/lang_english/icon_quote.gif" alt="Reply with quote" title="Reply with quote" border="0"/></a>   </td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><hr/></td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><span class="postbody">Getting textures to work properly on models is a pain. What I did was extract pak004.pk4(I think) and just matched what I did up with the ones I new actually worked.
<br/><br/>
You need like 3 different files. The model, the texture, and then a .mtr that actually sets it up to work properly.</span><span class="gensmall"/></td>
			</tr></table></td>
	</tr><tr><td class="row1" width="150" align="left" valign="middle"><span class="nav"><a href="viewtopic.php?p=160526#top" class="nav">Back to top</a></span></td>
		<td class="row1" width="100%" height="28" valign="bottom" nowrap="nowrap"><table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" border="0" height="18" width="18"><tr><td valign="middle" nowrap="nowrap"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/profile.php?mode=viewprofile&u=16934&sid=38862bb3a0426f0ed156be45955a72ca"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/lang_english/icon_profile.gif" alt="View user's profile" title="View user's profile" border="0"/></a> <a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/privmsg.php?mode=post&u=16934&sid=38862bb3a0426f0ed156be45955a72ca"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/lang_english/icon_pm.gif" alt="Send private message" title="Send private message" border="0"/></a>    <a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://edit.yahoo.com/config/send_webmesg?.target=kit_sof2@yahoo.co.uk&.src=pg"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/lang_english/icon_yim.gif" alt="Yahoo Messenger" title="Yahoo Messenger" border="0"/></a> <script language="JavaScript" type="text/javascript"><![CDATA[<!--

	</tr><tr><td width="150" align="left" valign="top" class="row2"><span class="name"><a name="161197"/><b>ratty redemption</b></span><br/><span class="postdetails">is sad because his cool title went away<br/><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/images/avatars/upload/187563792142c6d1bcb7ecf.jpg" alt="" border="0"/><br/><br/>Joined: 14 Dec 2004<br/>Posts: 699<br/>Location: milton keynes, england</span><br/></td>
		<td class="row2" width="100%" height="28" valign="top"><table width="100%" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0"><tr><td width="100%"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/viewtopic.php?p=161197&sid=38862bb3a0426f0ed156be45955a72ca#161197"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/icon_minipost.gif" width="12" height="9" alt="Post" title="Post" border="0"/></a><span class="postdetails">Posted: Tue Oct 31, 2006 9:31 pm<span class="gen"></span> Post subject: </span></td>
				<td valign="top" nowrap="nowrap"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/posting.php?mode=quote&p=161197&sid=38862bb3a0426f0ed156be45955a72ca"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/lang_english/icon_quote.gif" alt="Reply with quote" title="Reply with quote" border="0"/></a>   </td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><hr/></td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><span class="postbody">this is the second time I`ve built the first of my hell cages, the first version I had used 6 sided cylinders for the bars, which I then decided were a waste of polys, so reduced them to 4 sided. for some reason that took longer to build then the 6 sided version.
<br/><br/>
    and although I spent a lot of time on experimenting where to place the uv seams, I still ended up tweaking the uv map a lot which I haven`t had to do recently with the rock or terrain models.
<br/><br/>
    but while working on this hell cage I discovered the very useful "w key/align x or y" tool in the uv/image editor window. this ment I could quickly clean up the hell cage metal bars uv`s. so before I started bending them out of shape, I had a wip version where the uv`s were very neatly mapped to the polys with hardly any stretching, and after bending the bars I`m still very pleased with the uv map <img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/images/smiles/icon_smile.gif" alt="Smile" border="0"/><br/><br/>
    hopefully the next one of these cages I build I`ll be able to model and uv map it a lot quicker.
<br/><br/><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://img521.imageshack.us/my.php?image=image444fy7.jpg" target="_blank" class="postlink"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://img521.imageshack.us/img521/3629/image444fy7.th.jpg" border="0"/></a> <a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://img256.imageshack.us/my.php?image=image445bwq2.jpg" target="_blank" class="postlink"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://img256.imageshack.us/img256/3894/image445bwq2.th.jpg" border="0"/></a><br/>_________________<br/><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/viewtopic.php?t=17180&postdays=0&postorder=asc&start=0" target="_blank" class="postlink">(wip) ratty d3 hell map</a>
<br/><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.katsbits.com/" target="_blank" class="postlink">katsbits.com</a></span><span class="gensmall"/></td>
			</tr></table></td>
	</tr><tr><td class="row2" width="150" align="left" valign="middle"><span class="nav"><a href="viewtopic.php?p=160526#top" class="nav">Back to top</a></span></td>

			</tr></table></td>
	</tr><tr><td class="spaceRow" colspan="2" height="1"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/spacer.gif" alt="" width="1" height="1"/></td>
	</tr><tr><td width="150" align="left" valign="top" class="row1"><span class="name"><a name="161374"/><b>Goofos</b></span><br/><span class="postdetails">picked up the chaingun<br/><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/images/avatars/upload/18414829142c75390a2185.gif" alt="" border="0"/><br/><br/>Joined: 10 Mar 2005<br/>Posts: 163<br/>Location: black forrest</span><br/></td>
		<td class="row1" width="100%" height="28" valign="top"><table width="100%" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0"><tr><td width="100%"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/viewtopic.php?p=161374&sid=38862bb3a0426f0ed156be45955a72ca#161374"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/icon_minipost.gif" width="12" height="9" alt="Post" title="Post" border="0"/></a><span class="postdetails">Posted: Fri Nov 03, 2006 6:30 pm<span class="gen"></span> Post subject: </span></td>
				<td valign="top" nowrap="nowrap"><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/posting.php?mode=quote&p=161374&sid=38862bb3a0426f0ed156be45955a72ca"><img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/templates/subSilver/images/lang_english/icon_quote.gif" alt="Reply with quote" title="Reply with quote" border="0"/></a>   </td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><hr/></td>
			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><span class="postbody">Sorry, haven't read your previous post. A simple example, you need:
<br/><br/>
1. a Doom3 Material named
<br/><br/>
textures/base_wall/superpipes
<br/><br/>
2. a image for texturing in Blender, stored in the path
<br/><br/>
E:\Doom\base\textures\base_wall\superpipes.tga
<br/><br/>
3. in Blender a Material for your mesh with a Texture into which you load that image (once loaded you can select it in the UV editor)
<br/><br/>
If you export the model, you dont need to change the *BITMAP lines because it have a usable path doom3 can interpret as material. The only important thing is you have to store the image in the right path: 
<br/><br/>
\doom\base\ + material name as path
<br/><br/>
The drive letter and file extension doesn't matter.</span><span class="gensmall"/></td>
			</tr></table></td>
	</tr><tr><td class="row1" width="150" align="left" valign="middle"><span class="nav"><a href="viewtopic.php?p=160526#top" class="nav">Back to top</a></span></td>

			</tr><tr><td colspan="2"><span class="postbody">understood and thanks a lot goofos <img src="https://web.archive.org/web/20070509181516im_/http://www.doom3world.org/phpbb2/images/smiles/icon_smile.gif" alt="Smile" border="0"/><br/><br/>

post.author: ratty redemption
post.body:
understood and it took me a while to learn how to export even static meshes in blender, although the d3w blender forum helped a lot, especially if using goofos`s .ase exporter script for blender.

also various users have found different d3 paths work or don`t work for them, for me personally, I have all my .ase models use the "w:/doom/base/" prefix for the texture paths which works perfectly on my system, although I think kat uses one of the others.

the weird thing is I don`t have a w: drive or partition so it must be something coded into the engine from when they were developing it, but I remember I had great difficultly getting d3 to use my custom paths before using the prefix.

sorry if you already know the above fix, but someone reading this might not be even aware of this export issue let alone the fixes.

post.author: Bo$bevok
post.body:
no i thank you ratty because i was just trying one path
now iwill try some different ones

post.author: Goofos
post.body: It should also work with other drive letters. I extracted all textures to E:\Doom\base and if the image has the same name and path as the doom3 material it should work without altering the ase file.

post.author: ratty redemption
post.body:
Bo$bevok, cool and good luck

Goofos, I think I understand but could you post an example of a material shader and the material name you`d use in blender, or if you don`t want to in this thread, perhaps a link to an example in your .ase exporter`s development thread?

post.author: kit89
post.body:
Getting textures to work properly on models is a pain. What I did was extract pak004.pk4(I think) and just matched what I did up with the ones I new actually worked.

You need like 3 different files. The model, the texture, and then a .mtr that actually sets it up to work properly.

post.author: ratty redemption
post.body:
this is the second time I`ve built the first of my hell cages, the first version I had used 6 sided cylinders for the bars, which I then decided were a waste of polys, so reduced them to 4 sided. for some reason that took longer to build then the 6 sided version.

and although I spent a lot of time on experimenting where to place the uv seams, I still ended up tweaking the uv map a lot which I haven`t had to do recently with the rock or terrain models.

but while working on this hell cage I discovered the very useful "w key/align x or y" tool in the uv/image editor window. this ment I could quickly clean up the hell cage metal bars uv`s. so before I started bending them out of shape, I had a wip version where the uv`s were very neatly mapped to the polys with hardly any stretching, and after bending the bars I`m still very pleased with the uv map

hopefully the next one of these cages I build I`ll be able to model and uv map it a lot quicker.

post.author: Goofos
post.body:
Sorry, haven't read your previous post. A simple example, you need:

1. a Doom3 Material named

textures/base_wall/superpipes

2. a image for texturing in Blender, stored in the path

E:\Doom\base\textures\base_wall\superpipes.tga

3. in Blender a Material for your mesh with a Texture into which you load that image (once loaded you can select it in the UV editor)

If you export the model, you dont need to change the *BITMAP lines because it have a usable path doom3 can interpret as material. The only important thing is you have to store the image in the right path:

\doom\base\ + material name as path

The drive letter and file extension doesn't matter.

post.author: ratty redemption
post.body:
understood and thanks a lot goofos

post.author: BNA!
post.body:
ratty redemption wrote:
ot: thanks kit89 and we`re still considering options, but as we`ve got our pc`s in different rooms, it`s not easy to physically wire them together. I`ll pass on your concerns though.


Just don't leave them unprotected - enable encryption and you're all set.
Unless you're the CEO of an investment bank it's not worth the hassle for a hacker to bypass a 256bit key.

post.author: kit89
post.body:
Getting textures to work properly on models is a pain. What I did was extract pak004.pk4(I think) and just matched what I did up with the ones I new actually worked.

You need like 3 different files. The model, the texture, and then a .mtr that actually sets it up to work properly.

post.author: ratty redemption
post.body:
this is the second time I`ve built the first of my hell cages, the first version I had used 6 sided cylinders for the bars, which I then decided were a waste of polys, so reduced them to 4 sided. for some reason that took longer to build then the 6 sided version.

and although I spent a lot of time on experimenting where to place the uv seams, I still ended up tweaking the uv map a lot which I haven`t had to do recently with the rock or terrain models.

but while working on this hell cage I discovered the very useful "w key/align x or y" tool in the uv/image editor window. this ment I could quickly clean up the hell cage metal bars uv`s. so before I started bending them out of shape, I had a wip version where the uv`s were very neatly mapped to the polys with hardly any stretching, and after bending the bars I`m still very pleased with the uv map

hopefully the next one of these cages I build I`ll be able to model and uv map it a lot quicker.

post.author: Goofos
post.body:
Sorry, haven't read your previous post. A simple example, you need:

1. a Doom3 Material named

textures/base_wall/superpipes

2. a image for texturing in Blender, stored in the path

E:\Doom\base\textures\base_wall\superpipes.tga

3. in Blender a Material for your mesh with a Texture into which you load that image (once loaded you can select it in the UV editor)

If you export the model, you dont need to change the *BITMAP lines because it have a usable path doom3 can interpret as material. The only important thing is you have to store the image in the right path:

\doom\base\ + material name as path

The drive letter and file extension doesn't matter.

post.author: BNA!
post.body:
ratty redemption wrote:
ot: thanks kit89 and we`re still considering options, but as we`ve got our pc`s in different rooms, it`s not easy to physically wire them together. I`ll pass on your concerns though.


Just don't leave them unprotected - enable encryption and you're all set.
Unless you're the CEO of an investment bank it's not worth the hassle for a hacker to bypass a 256bit key.

post.date: Posted: Mon Oct 23, 2006 11:02 pm Post subject:
post.author: ratty redemption
post.body:
understood and it took me a while to learn how to export even static meshes in blender, although the d3w blender forum helped a lot, especially if using goofos`s .ase exporter script for blender.

also various users have found different d3 paths work or don`t work for them, for me personally, I have all my .ase models use the "w:/doom/base/" prefix for the texture paths which works perfectly on my system, although I think kat uses one of the others.

the weird thing is I don`t have a w: drive or partition so it must be something coded into the engine from when they were developing it, but I remember I had great difficultly getting d3 to use my custom paths before using the prefix.

sorry if you already know the above fix, but someone reading this might not be even aware of this export issue let alone the fixes.
